The Tax Picture

Ribble Valley's Band D council tax of £170.69 is the lowest of all eight Lancashire councils we monitor:

CouncilBand D
Ribble Valley£170.69
Chorley£215.99
South Ribble£236.78
Lancaster£264.30
Hyndburn£276.46
Pendle£307.52
Rossendale£317.66
Burnley£344.58

Context

Lower council tax doesn't necessarily mean fewer services. Ribble Valley's higher property values (and therefore higher council tax base) mean the council can generate adequate revenue at a lower rate. The borough's total service expenditure of £9,260k is the smallest in Lancashire, reflecting both its smaller population and the rural character of its service delivery.

Compare all eight councils on our Cross-Council Comparison page.
